name: Primrose
text: When I preen my feathers, I sound like a deck of cards being shuffled.

name: Primrose
text: I follow my humans around the house. Not for any reason, I just like being near them while they do other things.

name: Primrose
text: Every evening, I roost on top of the office door. And every evening, my people put me in my actual bed (on top of my favorite lamp). I protest this by nodding my head and making a threatening cooing sound.

name: Primrose
text: If it's been a while since I've had a bath, I'll act extra curious around water until my people get the hint and fill a bowl for me to splash around in.

name: Primrose
text: After a bath, I shake myself once to dry off, then I lay down on the floor, usually in a corner or by a wall, for an hour or so.

name: Primrose
text: I struggle picking up most seeds, so I only eat sorghum. I don't eat human food and I really don't like bean burritos.

name: Primrose
text: I have a stretching routine! I stretch a leg and wing on one side, then the other, then I scrunch my shoulderblades together to lift my wings.

name: Primrose
text: When my people leave their office, I immediately jump on their keyboard. One time I sent a Teams message and scheduled a meeting. It was a productive day.

name: Primrose
text: I, like all other birds, am a dinosaur. I'm not *descended* from dinosaurs, I *am* a dinosaur.
